website_summaries.verdict: The best gaming motherboard from ASUS for gamers wanting great performance and lighting.
pros: Board architecture is compatible with the current generation of Intel processors
Thunderbolt 3 support offers better speeds and reliability
cons: Motherboard can reach high temperatures when running intensive games and programs

website_summaries.verdict: A top-end gaming motherboard from the ASUS Prime series for serious gamers.
pros: Comes with a high-resolution DisplayPort for true 4K gaming with a compatible monitor
Plenty of USB ports for gaming accessories
cons: Mounting screws to fasten the motherboard to the PC case are often missing

customer_reviews.title: Fan control via Bios works perfect! Sound is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It fired right up. Bios with a mouse for the 1st time in my life! Found my xmp ram profile and loaded correct values. Fan control via Bios works perfect! Sound is fantastic. Everything works perfect.....zero issues. Maybe prices a tad high? Asus quality. *Edit. Read up on the Vdroop issue with Asus z370 boards. This board also has that issue when you try and overclock... Asus is supposedly working on a bios fix. Knocked a star off (for now). Need to get fixed asap by Asus
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: DIMM slots don't work
customer_reviews.text: So far my son and I have spent a month working with Tech support, wasting large chucks of time, trying to figure out why the DIMM slots will not accept two sticks of approved RAM at the same time. Based on Tech Supports requirements, we even purchased different types of RAM to try. Eventually we had to return the mother board since it did not work properly. Hopefully the replacement will not have this issue. Update - Amazon was willing to replace the board. New board arrived and it is working correctly. Don't quite understand why it took ASUS Customer Service a month to figure this out. Overall, disappointing - but happy to finally have a working board.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Good dependable Asus
customer_reviews.text: I could have got a z370 for not much more. However, I don't overclock, I won't ever overclock, and I wish there was more focus on features and stability instead of making sure "gaming" is in the name. Good stable board that "games" just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Micki

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Performance for Intel 8th Gen CPUs!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value for Intel 8th gen Z370 chipset. Has similar features to the Hero line of boards at a reduced cost. Was able to overclock my i7-8700k to 5.2ghz stable using this board. Lots of fan headers, and even an RGB header. USB 3.1 support is outstanding with even a type-C connector on the back. Included M.2 heat sync is a great feature at this price point as well as a VRM fan mount. The one very minor tiny complaint I have is I wish they would improve the I/O shield as it looks kind of cheap for a motherboard of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Not compatibale with older Intel CPUs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with Intel I5 7th Generation CPU, Actually I went crazy making this work, as I have built many systems, and am not a Dummy, so it just took me by surprise that this board and another one I bought from MSI, are not compatible with older CPUs. I would strongly suggest to Amazon, that they add filters and do let their clients know, that there might be an issue, making these two, and of course memory etc, all work with each other. It would have save me like a day :(( No fault of this board, I like Asus a LOT. Just a caution to everyone out thyere,a nd a request to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value motherboard. Super easy to install and set up, even flashing the BIOS was simple and I had never done it before. The box does not come sealed with tape, so I'm not sure if it was previously opened. The cardboard tab holding the box closed was somewhat "loose" so who knows. I am not sure what cables it should have come with since this is my first new motherboard purchase. Mine had a tiny bag of screws, a bag with 2 black SATA cables, and a bag with the i/o shield. I've been running my setup with this new mobo for a few days and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: SBG

customer_reviews.title: Could never get all ram slots to work
customer_reviews.text: For the most part it was easy to install. This was my first PC build. Because of that any areas I struggled with in terms of installation would have probably occurred with any motherboard. I didn't find the instructions to be all that clear in some areas. And I'm pretty sure by A Ram slots are not working and I eventually had to put both of my Corsair Vengeance chips into just the B slots. I have no idea what is going to happen when I upgrade to 4 chips. I have already past the return window so I am pretty much stuck with it even if something is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: TexasPickles

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit; Does what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Solid board (so far) with good video out options. Caution: To upgrade to support the Intel 9th Gen i7-9700k I read elsewhere that you need an 8th gen processor to upgrade the bios. The bios upgrade is easy (supports Internet based!) Cons: 50mm fan mount is useless. I'm using a Fractal Design Refine R5 case, and the Corsair 115i Pro 280 cooler - and there was zero space for the extra fan mount. I had to use an utility knife to shave off part of the cooler fan in order to mount the radiator on top (and need to purchase a low profile 140mm fan for rear exhaust)
customer_reviews.author: Microschool Family

customer_reviews.title: Good stable little work horse.
customer_reviews.text: Good stable backbone for my 9th gen Core I5 workstation. Comprehensive layout takes advantage of CPU heatsink airflow and case airflow to help keep critical components cool. As to be expected with Asus boards, bios is laid out well with many options and tweaks not found on many competitive boards. Impressive speed from both M.2 slots. I also do some light gaming on this system, and have no complaints about the performance. The only issue I have with the board is the position of the lower M.2 slot in relation to the Pcie slot. I use aftermarket heatsinks on my NVME drives and there can be interference issues with aftermarket heatsinks and larger graphics cards.
customer_reviews.author: PodGod

customer_reviews.title: great motherboard! except for 1 annoying thing
customer_reviews.text: sata port 1 is buggy, it wont detect drive while a usb device is plugged in at front usb port, sometimes it just doesnt detect the drive at all so switched ports and all went back to normal
customer_reviews.author: bryanzs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Hackintosh
customer_reviews.text: Used this successfully for a Hackintosh build, dual booting with Windows 10. Works 100% out of the box as the z370 chipset has native support in macOS 10.15.1 Catalina. Intel i9-9900k CPU was supported with the shipped firmware. Used 32GB (2x16) GSkill Trident 3200 RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Severian

customer_reviews.title: great board, if you're running a NVMe SSD you'll ...
customer_reviews.text: great board, if you're running a NVMe SSD you'll have to use the M slot by the CPU and change the settings in BIOS to X4 mode and the DMI link speed to Gen 3. That's how you'll get the max speed from your SSD. You might loose Sata 5 and 6 but the speed is worth it
customer_reviews.author: nix

customer_reviews.title: Asus is a very reliable brand for motherboards
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is a great value for thre money. I'm not going through tech specs, just search for it online. I wanted to build a PC that has enough SATA inputs and 4 slots for RAM. I also wanted to have thre ability to have LEDs since I bought a huge thermaltake case. Just by plugging this in, it has pretty lights. This motherboard is meant to be shown off. I just wish that the SATA connection is oriented a different way. My case makes it hard to have an angled end SATA cable. Overall, I highly recommend this to anyone who isn't going to do hard core video games. In my situation (casual gamer), it'll do fine.
customer_reviews.author: Drumlord29

customer_reviews.title: Quality motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: Used this motherboard for my first build, and love it. Very easy bios to use and high quality connections. I dislike the i/o plate, but that is my only complaint. I installed 32gb of corsair ddr4 3000mhz ram, a samsung evo plus 970 250gb m2 drive, an i5 9600k and an RTX 2060 6gb gpu. This pc is a beast.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: ASUS makes great boards an their customer support was great
customer_reviews.text: ASUS makes great boards an their customer support was great .. since This was my first computer build..they really helped me pick the correct RAM & CPU.. Original ASUS board was still working when I replaced it . It was 14 years old.. this new one worked flawlessly.. for PROTOOLS music computer..great price too!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First one DEAD ON ARRIVAL
customer_reviews.text: The Mobo is nice, BUT: LEDs are present to indicate issues during boot. Right after install, I had an Orange LED (RAM ISSUE) I had BRAND NEW out of the box RAM. Tested both RAM sticks separately in one slot and PC booted. Process of elimination, RAM sticks were fine, second RAM slot on MOBO was not functional. Amazon was great and was quick to issue me a replacement. No issues with second MOBO so far......just be aware this could happen to you too.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard, but incorrect riser screw for m.2 SSD knocked off a star for this rating
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I had with this motherboard was the fact that when I installed the m.2 SSD, the screw needed to secure the drive into the board never came with the SSD. There was an incorrect sized standoff and screw that came packaged in the motherboard, but it would not fit to save my life. Not having the correct screw delayed my PC build by over 5 days. I finally googled and found a m.2 ssd standoff and screw kit and purchased it separately on amazon. Here is the link to that purchase.  That inconvenience alone made me knock off a star to this phenomenal board. The board itself is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Used Defective Motherboard Sold as New
customer_reviews.text: 3 weeks after installing this motherboard in a W10 system it stopped booting. I tried all the recommended diagnostic steps, but it wouldn't change. When I tried to return it to ASUS on two separate occasions, they said it had been registered before. I was precise about entering the Serial Number. That means that Amazon sold me a previously sold, known defective unit as new and I'm stuck with the bill. Can you guess how much business I will do with Amazon after this?
customer_reviews.author: SetterSpeaker

customer_reviews.title: Used both B360M and Prime Z370-A II
customer_reviews.text: I can only leave one review for both of these motherboards. I didn't have any issues with the Prime Z370-A II. Worked perfect IMHO. For the B360-M, I installed an Intel i5-9400f and 1080 ti video card. Used nvme storage, and it's off to the races. On one computer, the bios wouldn't boot using ddr4-3200 setting. Worked fine with ddr4-2666 with the same memory. So, dropping one star for memory compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Met My Very High Expectations
customer_reviews.text: In part, I went with ASUS specifically because they are an established brand with a track record of quality. I won an 8086k from Intel so I had to replace my current MOBO and I'm really glad I did. I was really disappointed with the functionality and performance of the MSI board that this board replaced, so I had very high hopes. Great OC options, brilliant design, and a very decent balance between "ease of use" and functionality. I dual boot Mint and Windows 10, use a M.2 and have 2 mechanical drives setup in a RAID and I had zero issues getting it all configured. I'll just stick with ASUS from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Camen Diener

customer_reviews.title: Great for this first time builder
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic motherboard. As a first time builder, it was easy to work with, and had plenty of features. Had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I love Asus
customer_reviews.text: You will never catch my buying any other Motherboard brand than ASUS. I have had such a good experience with them so far that I will never branch out! Great brand with amazing products. Convinced that they use the best Micro-Transistors and Micro-Capacitors.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Zangirolami

customer_reviews.title: Two Motherboards, Two DOA
customer_reviews.text: First time, I have ever had issues with ASUS boards in nearly 20 years of PC building. I have received two motherboards now that are DOA. Tested all components in different configurations and everything works fine with different LGA1151 Motherboard, this board just spins up and dies. Multiple working power supplies, in the case, outside of the case (just to ensure there wasn't a ground point) same issue throughout. I'm trying the MicroATX by Gigabyte next.
customer_reviews.author: jason schelert

customer_reviews.title: I know NOTHING about computers, but mines working amazing now!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not certain what this product does, but my computer is SUPER fast and can handle the extensive workload I give it! I work from home and go to school from home, and I'm on my computer an average 14+ hours a day. I needed a better computer than the basic pre-built HP tower I purchased from Best Buy, so my husband showed me how to virtually build a computer from PC Part Picker, and this was a recommended component. My husband is a PC gamer and he's now jealous of how much better my tower is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ASUS makes many great motherboards
customer_reviews.text: ASUS Corporation makes many quality products. I build all of my systems with ASUS motherboards and other ASUS parts.
customer_reviews.author: ABCServices

customer_reviews.title: HDMI dead on Arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Interestingly, this MB offers VGA, DVI, and HDMI output. I am giving it 4 stars because of the accessibility. (Even has PS2 mouse and keyboard inputs.) However, my MB's HDMI was dead on Arrival. this isnt an issue as I was able to use the VGA up until my GPU was properly updated, but for those who plan on using this MB as a media device without a GPU, it might be a bigger issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amburger

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhh the Asus z370-A II such AMAZING quality and Good Lokking!
customer_reviews.text: It's Asus guys and gals. Dependable, quality, warranty and will last for years. When you buy a Z370 motherboard there are many other choices, but Asus brand has a reputation for close attention to performance. This is a high end motherboard, not a cheap no name. I have built many Z370 systems and find this Asus board seems to always out perform other brands.
customer_reviews.author: TECHNolli

customer_reviews.title: I like the motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: Can I use a PWM Fan Splitter Adapter Cable Sleeved Braided Y Splitter Computer PC 4 Pin Fan Extension Power Cable 1 to 3 Converter 10 inches (2 Pack) TeamProfitcom to control my RGB fans on my motherboard since I only have one RGB header on my motherboard? I tried the Commador Pro. and the Nobe Pro. but I didn't have enough room for them in (on) my ATX motherboard.And my computer case is a full tower case? Can someone help my with this situation?
customer_reviews.author: Black Suede

customer_reviews.title: A cheap but good z370 board.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before any of the inexpensive 300s chipsets were released and as such it was one of the cheapest boards at the time. However it is still a very good value being not much more expensive than a lot of the 360/60/10 boards and it having a full set of features with some nice small additions and a nice looking underglow.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Solid offering from ASUS as always
customer_reviews.text: It has the latest features and has plenty of interfaces for many different build types. For the money, you cannot beat price per feature. Solid offering from ASUS, and very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: jeri

customer_reviews.title: RELIABLE, COST EFFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - versatile board - reliability (thank you asus!) - beautiful Cons: none This board is a great option compared to the z370-E ROG board if you dont mind missing out on a few LEDS and mainly the loss of wifi. They're pretty comparable boards and I thought I would save myself the $50 and snag this board instead. I was not disappointed, and asus has continually delivered top tier products.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Alexander

customer_reviews.title: RAID Issues
customer_reviews.text: Normally, I love ASUS motherboards. However, this one will not boot from a RAID 1. The config screens list the RAID as bootable, however, the boot screens do not. When trying to install Windows 10, the installer can see the "single" drive, but says that the drive is not bootable, and Windows cannot be installed. I have set up this configuration on other ASUS boards last month with no issue. So far, ASUS support has been no help.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality motherboard that works and looks great
customer_reviews.text: The motherboard shipped out and arrived on time. Packaged well. The motherboard was used in a new build. It looks great, seems very well made. Easy to install and works as it should. Setting screen is easy to navigate and everything works as it should. I would buy another one and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LLP

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Z390? Not sure..
customer_reviews.text: I have been moving away from Asus as they have been limiting features since this generation chipset. Stil a great MOBO, very nice looking, and was easy to flash. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon T.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Tech/Customer Support - Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the mother board would not accept both sets of RAM. When we called ASUS originally they asked us to check back in a few days to see if they had a replacement in stock. When we called back, we then got a different story. We were going to have to disassemble the computer and ship them the defective motherboard back. We were told to expect that to take a week or more plus shipping. When pressed to send an advance replacement due to their defective unit we were quoted company policy by several representatives. Bottom line no one was empowered to do the right thing. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Another great Asus product!
customer_reviews.text: After updating the bios our new gaming pc/server the motherboard worked perfectly. Only thing I could wish for is one more rgb header, nothing a splitter couldn't fix. Paired this with a i3 and 16gbs of memory along with a 1050ti,gaming performance is perfect for what we play.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Died after a month
customer_reviews.text: ASUS motherboard are great, but I had a bad experience with PRIME B360M-A. The install went well but one month later I couldnt turn on the new PC build. I was met with no beep sound and the system refused to post and the monitor stayed dark. The case fans and the CPU and graphics board fans all turned on as well as the LEDs. Close inspection showed the orange motherboard DRAM light was continuously on. I'd tested the memories sticks, cpu processor, all the cables, power supply, cleared CMOS, HDD but no success at all. Now I had a died board. Better luck next time.
customer_reviews.author: Tulio Henrique Alves dos Santos

customer_reviews.title: Great M.2 Cooling!
customer_reviews.text: I've always used ASUS MOBOs, and this one did not disappoint. Of all the great things about this board, the M.2 heat sink is the best....I'm running a Samsung EVO 960 and it normally runs at room temp, the highest I've ever had it is 115 F. Gotta love that!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard is well designed and well labeled
customer_reviews.text: This item was received in a timely manner and in working condition. I was pleasantly surprised at how well designed it is. Everything is well labeled and laid out in an intuitive way. The only problem I had was that the flange that comes with the motherboard was hard to install properly in between the motherboard and the case itself. There are some tabs that kept getting stuck in the HDMI slots instead of sliding underneath and the whole thing didn't line up properly with the ports until I worked with it for several minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Dover8888

customer_reviews.title: Well it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I had a motherboard die on me and I purchased this to replace it. This is a very basic motherboard. If RGB is your thing shy away. Granted this isn’t a horrible board it’s just not very modern. My box came without any driver discs nor an IO shield. For the price of this, I’d say spend the extra $30 and get the Asus Prime Z320. This board could be $40 and it would be a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Reiss

customer_reviews.title: Typical Asus mobo - rock solid
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy although I did have to update BIOS for final use. Once done, It's rocking away! My client is very pleased with the performance up-grade from his prior system. One note- best performance requires a recent power supply with 8-pin connection. older supplies typically have 12
customer_reviews.author: kahunascout

customer_reviews.title: Good Motherboard for it's price. Not best but good enough
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale and it really was worth the sale price than regular MSRP. The lights on the side aren't as clean as you'd expect, not like G trident rgb ram that everyone buys. But aura syncing it made it more bearable. Motherboard lights stay on when PC is off, so that's for you to decide if you like it or not. For the led bulb types they use on the side, not really my thing. Hard to get in some case screws because of the port shield in the back, so tight fit some places. Good motherboard so far.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Solid option for good budget build
customer_reviews.text: Works tremendously with my intel i5-9600k and EVGA TUFF Gaming 2060 GPU. cheap board but works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Chase H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid motherboard has everything you need
customer_reviews.text: Supports both 8th gen and 9th gen processors. HDMI, DVI and Displayport allow for 3 simultaneous monitor connections. An economical way to setup a triple monitor setup.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good motherboard but broken after a few months
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was working great and I really like the LED on it, the BIOS is awesome, just a really solid motherboard. Until just a few months after installation the USB 3.1 port on the back suddenly stopped working despite doing nothing to damage it and no apparent signs of physical damage.
customer_reviews.author: RoadWarrior

customer_reviews.title: Decent mATX
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic board with older specs. My biggest complaint is that the SATA connectors are a little loose right out of the box and the back plate is very basic with annoying pins. Also what is up with the PS2 connectors? Good board for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: and out of the three motherboards I've used this is the best. Quick and easy startup time with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I have built three PCs over the years, and out of the three motherboards I've used this is the best. Quick and easy startup time with no issues. I have had issues with the BIOS on the other two, nothing with this one. I would give it the full five stars, but the one downside was downloading the chip-set drivers. The Asus website did't really organize the data well to find the drivers, and the page itself was a little bit confusing on what to download or what not to. Other than that however great product! Would recommend to anybody
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Prime review
customer_reviews.text: Great board, doesn't come with thermal paste or any type of brass grounding pegs for the pc case installation, but otherwise 100% recommend. The board comes with all of the higher end features without the pricetag.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Crowell

customer_reviews.title: Great Board
customer_reviews.text: I bought this board for some of the features included which my previous mobo didn't have, including more expansion slots and thunderbolt 3 capabilities. With the exact same cpu and other hardware it actually runs about 5% faster! No other changes! Very stable board.
customer_reviews.author: VikingShips

customer_reviews.title: Great Product with Numerous Features
customer_reviews.text: This product has many features, which is what I like about it. Plenty of options for any build. Works as expected. The aura-sync is a nice addition as well. I would recommend this if you plan on using most of the features, otherwise I would recommend a cheaper option for better value.
customer_reviews.author: bangorfb

customer_reviews.title: Numerous different products with reviews combined makes this useless
customer_reviews.text: My review is for the PRIME B360M-A. A good board. But the reviews here reference several boards so you don't know which review goes to which product. Why?
customer_reviews.author: The Other Geek

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard came with zero accessories. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this package a few months back and ONLY received the motherboard. No Q connector, data cables, SLI bridge, fan holder, screws, cpu installed tool, user Manuel and disc. Very disappointed. I have sent an email requesting the parts. This review will change when I have heard back. Would not recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Martins

customer_reviews.title: USED BOARDS
customer_reviews.text: They are used and they will not do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: andrew b

customer_reviews.title: Not wireless
customer_reviews.text: The specifications state the wireless is 802.11AC but this board doesn't have wireless. You get 1 star for wasting my time with incorrect information. I would not have bought this board had I known that.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Breijak

customer_reviews.title: I am not a super RGB lights fan
customer_reviews.text: I am not a super RGB lights fan. This motherboard offers me plenty of power, expansion, and comes with ASUS reliability. I purchased this for my first home built computer, and I cannot thank ASUS enough for making the build idiot proof. I did a lot of watching of YouTube videos and ASUS came through with a quality and reliable product. The BIOS is easy to use, and the EZ BIOS overclocking software makes overclocking of my 8700K chip easy peasy. I am very happy with the ease of installation and performance of this motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy2007

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: The motherboard did not work. It was used(like new). The lga1151 was damaged nothing worked. I’m very disappointed with this motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: LC 0701

customer_reviews.title: Once again received defective motherboard
customer_reviews.text: My advice, test them right out of the box with P.Supply, Mem and CPU. I'm getting tired of wasting time building a system and finding that I've again been sent a dead M.B.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but works great and syncs rgb with the corsair ram
customer_reviews.text: I paid $148 and think $120-$125 would be more appropriate. M.2 sata SSD does not work in the top slot. NVME only. The 2nd slot will work with either or but you want to nvme that one due to the nice included heatsink that only fits there.
customer_reviews.author: T. Luggiero

customer_reviews.title: Asus has the best bios hands down
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge fan of rgb but good luck finding a board without it now a days. Easy install and the wonderful idiot proof bios that makes Asus stand apart in the MB department. IO was a bit of a pain to get in and on the flimsy side but that is par for every manufacturer. The other pain was turning off the disco lights rgb when the system is shut down. Could not find in the user manual for where to turn it off, had to Google it and find where it was buried in the bios. All in all great MB!
customer_reviews.author: CVillain

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade MB
customer_reviews.text: I have loaded it up with most of the PCIe slots filled; 8 drives running (2 on PCIe expansion board) and M.2 drive as my C drive. Running great on games and as my video editing console. Should have upgraded earlier but happy with this MB. Recommend highly....
customer_reviews.author: Starlyter

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Works good but only thing that made me give it 4 stars is that the rgb should be more clear because as a noob I couldn’t understand and gave up although I got some of the fans working the others dident. But that’s not a product thing ig it’s more of a me being lazy.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: got 1 boards then a replacement, neither one would post without a video card, the on board video wouldn't work. asus wanted to take up to 2 weeks to determine why the board wasn't working. BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You don't need an I3/5/7 with built in graphics!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely laid out motherboard. Could use additional fan headers and temp sensor headers. (Bios supports 4 aux temp, only 1 header) like all 1151 boards, check cpu compatibility before buying. This board has built on GPU, so you don't need an I3/5/7 with built in graphics! Buy accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wormsley

customer_reviews.title: Very budget-oriented B360 at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This board was very cheap, costing only $50 renewed. For the price, it's a very good board. It has all the features a basic motherboard needs, and isn't too bad on the VRM side (not that you'll be overclocking as it is a locked chipset). If you want to use a pentium or i3 or locked i5, I would strongly recommend the board. The only weak point is the lack of rear USB ports, with only 4. However there are plenty of USB headers inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Budjet boards
customer_reviews.text: Micro ATX. Will build 2 systems for us. Have a six core to put on one and a i7 for the other. First time a build on 1151. Never have a issue with Asus, the QC is there.
customer_reviews.author: PC Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Easy auto overclocking
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use tech support lol, but its about as easy as any other mother board to install. It has Very good auto overclocking. I have a single fan noctua cooler with a i7 8700k it likes to hang out aroumd 4.8 to 4.99, but never hits 5 ghz very satisfyed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken pieces and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed that the motherboard I received had broken pieces on the motherboard and parts that were supposed to be there weren't. At first I thought that the broken part would be in the box as everything was piled loosely on top of the motherboard that didn't even have an anti static bag around it, but it wasn't. Which leads me to believe that it was packed horribly already broken. Asus has always been great for us, but apparently not so good sold by Lagoom Sales. This is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Little Miss Thing Thing

customer_reviews.title: 4Pin 12V RGB Header - heads up
customer_reviews.text: The motherboard was simple to work with as I installed the CPU along with the air cooler. The one thing I knew about going into the works is that the RGB header is a 4pin 12v so passing that info along is the best I can do. The motherboard was a great choice for my first build giving a sense of indication whether something isn't installed properly and the easy power through a button rather than jumping the power switch pins.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Parra

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Plain beautiful Mobo, amazing feature but no wifi. Make sure to plug in cpu power and CPU fans first bearly had no space to install after it's in the case. Windows 10 is giving me issues with AI suit when running the OS but the bios is the same thing so you can program it threw there.
customer_reviews.author: Marrero Family

customer_reviews.title: Great Mobo
customer_reviews.text: Love this mobo it was a great upgrade for my computer, it’s a tad larger than my old mobo so Installing got crammed in my case. Overall way better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Sexy, and Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy after a few months of use. This is a solid piece of beauty helping to power a beast of a setup. We wouldn't hesitate to buy again, but this will be outdated long before any issues would arise.
customer_reviews.author: BostonsPhotos

customer_reviews.title: Good motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Built my own gaming system and this MB has worked perfectly. -1 one star for installation. I could never get the backplane to seat correctly. Either the MB or case or maybe both just wouldn’t line up (or it could have been me, too).
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Great value and features.
customer_reviews.text: Love the board. Easy to install and use. If your using the top m.2 slot for an nvme drive you will need to modify the settings within the BIOS and dedicate 4x pcie lanes for max performance. (You tube has several vidoes on how to do this.) Over all I like it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: THE RAM CONTROLLERS ARE INDEED BAD IN THIS BOARD!
customer_reviews.text: Someone else mentioned BAD DIMM SLOTS!! THERE ARE 100% correct!! I run a computer shop, I bought 3 of these boards. It would NOT BOOT with two sticks of RAM. It WILL BOOT with only 1 stick of RAM! updated the BIOS , STILL SAME PROBLEM!! I had 2 other identical boards, I pulled out the bad board, installed another , and the 2nd boards RAM CONTROLLER DOES IN FACT WORK, but the FIRST BOARD WAS FAULTY!! Anyones guess on the 3rd board, I will test it tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Huston

customer_reviews.title: All you probably need
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good motherboard as far as I can tell. Have had it installed for about a day now. Everything works, only things I would make sure other buyers know are it doesnt have wifi/bluetooth, and the m.2 slots are sortof elevated like 1/2 inch off the the surface, not sure how common that is, but it took me off guard. They work like they should though. Only one rgb header and one USB 2.0 header. Does have good bios and overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Salopek

customer_reviews.title: Bios is great, easy to use and manage
customer_reviews.text: So far, working as intended and desired. Bios is great, easy to use and manage, and very user friendly. It can be navigated with either keyboard solo, or it does have full mouse interactivity. All options are very clear and easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Morphew

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and nonfunctional motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was easy to install, and a great value. The bios is very user friendly and info on the system temperature is segmented and easy to find. However, when I originally ordered this motherboard, a few of the parts were missing (the iOS shield and the q connector) bar that, when everything was installed the motherboard boot for a second then shut off. I'm not sure what happened to this particular motherboard, but Amazon sent a replacement within 2 days of my call, which is awesome. This would be 5 stars had everything been in the box and working.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much as advertised. Really easy setup. Not sure if this is normal but the bios is a bit clunky. Not a big deal since you don’t spend much time in there. Reviews complained about the lack of RGB lighting but it didn’t nothing me any. I added other components that have RGB lighting.
customer_reviews.author: redman2751

customer_reviews.title: Great MOBO, easy install, not Addressable RGB
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, the only thing (which is probably my fault for not reading properly) the RGB connections are not for 3-pin aRGB but or the 4-pin RGB (not addresable). Really easy install and comes with a CPU install tool which makes it easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: luis8752

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This is my most favorite motherboard because it comes with ASUS Quick Install which will install all the drivers for you.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Philter

customer_reviews.title: Low cost, good features.
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard for the price. Features are good, and the BIOS is implemented well. I updated the BIOS after receiving it, which you will want to do anyway. My only complaint is the IO shield is not that great, otherwise a great product. Thanks Asus!
customer_reviews.author: Dana L

customer_reviews.title: Virutec Computer Repair Approved.
customer_reviews.text: I run a small computer repair store and only leave reviews on the things I feel meet expectations. I am giving this item a 5 star because It works great with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Virutec Computer Repair

customer_reviews.title: Crashes When Paired With i7-8700k
customer_reviews.text: i7-8700k with newly installed Windows 10 will BSOD sporadically unless you enter your BIOS settings and disable C-States, SpeedStep, and TurboMode. Not sure how this slipped through testing since the i7-8700k is one of the more popular processors at the time of writing this.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I L-O-V-E this motherboard. Comes with multiple LED lights ...
customer_reviews.text: I L-O-V-E this motherboard. Comes with multiple LED lights and can be programmed on your desktop with the AURA sync application to light up how you want it. I left it on the default rainbow glow for now. So far no issues with the hardware performance.
customer_reviews.author: Brock G

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was sold when I saw a USB type C on a budget micro board. I wanted something cheap. Something that could handle intel 8th gen cpus. Something that had usb type C. And something that was made by Asus. I love Asus. And using these new products of theirs, I realize why I fell in love with them. Good job. Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Jalaleen

customer_reviews.title: ASUS quality and perfect for out of the box OC on intel 8700K ...
customer_reviews.text: No thrills high OC potential relatively low cost MB. ASUS quality and perfect for out of the box OC on intel 8700K with a good cooler. RGB on the side is meh. But I like the black/white theme. matched with a white GPU and white RAM DIMMS
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and setup
customer_reviews.text: Looked at a lot of boards before buying this one. I'm very happy with this board was easy to install and set up. Been running for about 6 months no problems
customer_reviews.author: exlogger

customer_reviews.title: Board Crashed OS in back up hard drive... Now I have no OS..
customer_reviews.text: Tried downgrading to windows 7 after deciding I didn’t like windows 10. Tried to revert this and the hard drive said no. Fine, went to go in, reformat the hard drive cool should work fine now. NOPE INSTEAD THE BOARD DECIDES ITS GONNA CRASH MY OTHER HARD DRIVES OS SO NOW I HAVE 2 HARD DRIVES AND NO OS. It also refuses to boot through Sata6 Hard drive IF M.2 is connected. Will NEVER use Asus again
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Great hackintosh board
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for hackintosh builds. Works really well and seems like a quality board.
customer_reviews.author: Dev null

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, no issues
customer_reviews.text: Excellent interface which was easy to navigate and modify settings. Sound quality is also very nice. Performing as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Grey S

customer_reviews.title: Prime Board!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. No problem with board and pc replacement motherboard. Only issue was Microsoft re activation issues of which they did efficiently help me get win 10 and office back on their activation list.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Used on my very first computer build which I’m using for music production. Pretty solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: Incredible kluH

customer_reviews.title: Fully featured, affordable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Fully featured and affordable! Has everything you need from a motherboard. Easy to install, easy to use. The BIOS utility is also very nifty
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my son who was building his own computer, which he is going to school for. He installed it worked for 3 days and the performance slowly went downhill to the point it is almost not working at all. He was only able to play one game on his new computer before this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Allen

customer_reviews.title: Got a bad board
customer_reviews.text: Board died within three months of use. Got sold a bad board that I had thought was new. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: getrightwityou

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Worksed, gave it away to someone else, no idea how long it lasted
customer_reviews.author: Athena Pantekoek

customer_reviews.title: 11 month lifespan
customer_reviews.text: It worked great when I got it and for the 11 months I have been using it. One day it just stopped turning on. Tried booting with the bare essentials and a different PSU (which worked on another pc) to no avail. All said and done, the board cost me under $15 a month before it died. Would be 5 star if it lasted half as long as my sabretooth from my old build.
customer_reviews.author: a m

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The motherboard itself looks really cool, with a clean design. Had no issues installing any of my parts to it. Also went fine into my new case.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was a pain to setup and ultimately didn’t live up to its advertised capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable Coffee Lake revision board.
customer_reviews.text: I did have to install a PCI-E card for wireless and bluetooth, which is not built into the board. Otherwise the board does everything I need, and seems solidly built. Comes with M.2 standoff (A previous board I purchased didn't)
customer_reviews.author: RazielXSR

product_meta.title: ASUS PRIME Z370-A LGA1151 DDR4 DP HDMI DVI M.2 USB 3.1 Z370 ATX Motherboard with USB 3.1 for 8th Generation Intel Core Processors
product_meta.description: Style:Prime Z370-A| Size:ATXDesigned for 8th generation Intel Core processors, the Prime Z370-A delivers maximum performance with customizable style. 5-Way Optimization provides intelligent auto-tuning and dynamic fan calibration, AURA Sync RGB with addressable headers and 3D printing mounts customize your build, while Dual M.2 and USB 3.1 Gen2 delivers maximum transfer speeds. Our motherboards are proven to be compatible with more than 1,000 components and devices, and each new model undergoes a minimum of 8,000 hours of strict validation. ASUS gives you the peace of mind of knowing that your motherboard is fit for all environments and applications. By choosing ASUS, you also gain the freedom to select outstanding component options, for trouble-free DIY experiences. Multi-gpu supports nvidia 2-Way sli technology and supports amd 3-way crossfirex technology. Storage supports intel smart response technology, supports raid 5, 0, 10, 1 and intel rapid storage technology
feature_bullets: Designed exclusively for 8th generation Intel Core processors to maximize connectivity and speed with Dual M.2, USB 3.1 Gen2, Intel Thunderbolt 3 support and Intel Optane Memory compatibility
5-Way Optimization with Auto-Tuning and FanXpert 4 automatically tailors overclocking profiles to your unique build for maximum OC performance and dynamic system cooling
Unmatched Personalization with ASUS exclusive AURA Sync RGB lighting, additional RGB header and 3D-printing mounts; Supports DisplayPort with max. resolution 4096 x 2304 @ 60 Hz
Two Patent-pending Safe Slots feature an injection molding process that integrates metal framing for a stronger, firmly anchored PCIe slot built for heavyweight GPUs ; 4-pin PWM/DC fan
Industry-leading 8-channel HD audio enhanced by ASUS exclusive Realtek S1220A featuring Crystal Sound 3 and driven by Japanese capacitors for warm, immersive sound

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars830 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
